page.title: 20LUDLOW FESTIVAL
page.content: The festival has its roots in a tradition of drama in the Castle established in the 1950's with a series of productions in aid of the restoration of St. Lawrences' Parish Church. From a modest beginning in 1960 the Festival has grown steadily until,25 years on,it has a national reputation. Its central feature is the professional production of a Shakespeare play in the open air setting of Ludlow Castle.The play runs for some 15 performances in late June and early July and in 25 years only 2 of 400 performances have been rained off completely.Evening performances on fine summer nights often generate a quite magical atmosphere as night descends on the auditorium.
